intro: Microlagenaria, commonly known as the small nettle. It is a genus of flowering plants in the family Urticaceae, characterized by its stinging hairs and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant. Microlagenaria species are known for their medicinal properties and are sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
